metadata.title: CVE-2020-14347 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way xserver memory was not properly initialized.This could leak parts of server memory to the X client. In cases where Xorgserver runs with elevated privileges, this could result in possible ASLRbypass. Xorg-server before version 1.20.9 is vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xdmx-tools - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xnest - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xorg-server-source - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xserver-common - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xvfb - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
xwayland - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9
No subscription required

xmir-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.3
xorg-server-source-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.3
xserver-xephyr-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.3
xserver-xorg-core-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.3
xserver-xorg-legacy-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.3
xwayland-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.9').
xorg-server-hwe-16.04 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.3').
